* Eclipse 3.3M4, DTP 1.0 on Ubuntu *

1. Create a new driver template for Apache Derby embedded using the Pref page
2. Create a new connection profile, select Apache Derby
--> Notice that the first (and only in this case) driver template is automatically  chosen in the combo box, but none of the template values are added to the rest of the wizard fields. This is different from Windows where no driver template is chosen by default, and selecting one refreshes the rest of the wizard fields. If you have more than one template and flip between them, then the wizard starts to update. If you have only one template, however, you can not get the wizard to refresh. Brian,

This looks like an SWT oddity.  Please review the initialization code for the wizard page to make sure the execution paths are valid (i.e. the controls are created, then initialized, then validated).  My guess is that something is out of order on Ubuntu.  Most likely, the fields are being initialized from a listener on the driver definition drop list.  The listener is probably notified when the initial selection is set on Windows, but not on Ubuntu.  You might want to scan BZ to see if this is a known problem in SWT/JFace.

Rob

Was able to reproduce on Ubuntu. We've discovered a discrepancy between org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Combo behavior on Windows and Linux (Ubuntu). When you do a programmatic selection (i.e. this.mComboList.select(0);), it doesn't trigger the Change event (i.e. I have added a change listener to the control). 

I have a workaround, but we suspect this may be a bug in the Platform code. Have submitted BZ entry 173939 to let them know. Have submitted patch to Rob Cernich for review that I tested on both Windows and Ubuntu and it works fine.
Committed fix for this issue today to the DTP codeline. Will come up with example to give the SWT team to try and reproduce.
